intro: Loeselia coccinea, commonly known as the red loeselia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which bloom in clusters and are often used in ornamental gardening. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Loeselia coccinea thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
